title: Gather Ingredients
description: Collect all necessary ingredients for making Pasta Carbonara, including bacon or guanciale, cheese, eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.
original_steps: Gather the ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta), pecorino romano cheese, free-range organic eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.

title: Prepare Meat
description: Chop the bacon or guanciale into small pieces and cook until crispy, optionally adding garlic for flavor.
original_steps: Cut guanciale (or pancetta) into chunks.
Heat olive oil in a pan and cook the guanciale until it releases fat.
Prepare the guanciale by removing the skin and slicing it into 1 cm slices, then chop into 0.5 cm chunks.
Place the guanciale in a cold pan and turn the heat to medium-high to render the fat.
Crack a garlic clove and add it to the pan with the guanciale to infuse flavor.
Once the guanciale is golden, remove the garlic from the pan.
Cut about half a pound of thick-cut bacon into three-quarter inch pieces.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add a tiny bit of olive oil (optional).
Add the bacon to the pan and slowly render out the fat until the bacon is crispy.
Once the bacon is crispy, remove some for garnish and drain most of the fat, leaving about two tablespoons in the pan. Turn off the heat.
Chop bacon into small pieces.
Cook the bacon in a pan until crispy, then turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.

title: Prepare Egg Mixture
description: Grate the cheese and mix it with eggs and black pepper to create the egg mixture.
original_steps: In a bowl, beat two egg yolks for the sauce.
Add grated parmesan or pecorino cheese and abundant pepper to the egg yolks and mix well.
Crack black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sift to use the hotter inner part of the peppercorn.
Crack eggs into a bowl and add 20 grams of pecorino romano cheese. Whisk together.
Grate three ounces each of Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese.
In a bowl, whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
Mix the grated cheeses into the egg mixture.
Add fresh ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture to taste.
Separate egg yolks from egg whites and place the yolks in a bowl.
Grate pecorino romano cheese and add it to the egg yolks.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture.

title: Cook Pasta
description: Boil salted water and cook the pasta until it is al dente, reserving some pasta water for later use.
original_steps: Boil water and add salt at a ratio of 10 grams per liter.
Add spaghettoni to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Boil water for the pasta, adding a small amount of salt.
Twist the pasta and place it into the boiling water to prevent sticking. Cook for 8 minutes.
Boil about four quarts of water and add a tablespoon of kosher salt.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water until slightly al dente, about 10 minutes.
Boil water in a pot and add salt.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water before draining the spaghetti.

title: Combine Ingredients
description: Mix the cooked pasta with the meat in the pan, then add the egg and cheese mixture, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce. Adjust the consistency with reserved pasta water if needed.
original_steps: Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the pan with guanciale, allowing it to cool slightly.
Mix the pasta with the egg mixture, ensuring the pasta is not too hot to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Stir the pasta until the sauce is creamy and coats the pasta evenly.
Turn off the heat under the guanciale pan and add the cooked pasta directly from the pot, including some pasta water, to stop frying and start emulsifying.
Toss the pasta in the pan with the guanciale fat and pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta, tossing quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Adjust the sauce consistency by adding more pasta water if needed.
Transfer the cooked spaghetti to the pan with the bacon using tongs, leaving the pasta water in the pot.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the spaghetti, stirring gently to avoid scrambling the eggs.
If needed, add a little pasta water to loosen the sauce and achieve a creamy consistency.
Add a small amount of reserved pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese.
Transfer the cooked spaghetti directly from the pot to the pan with bacon.
Mix the spaghetti with the bacon and then add the egg yolk and cheese mixture.
Stir quickly to combine, allowing the heat from the pasta to cook the egg yolks and create a creamy sauce. Add more pasta water if needed to achieve desired creaminess.

title: Garnish and Serve
description: Add additional cheese and black pepper as garnish before serving the Pasta Carbonara.
original_steps: Serve with additional grated parmesan or pecorino and a touch of pepper for decoration.
Finish with additional cracked black pepper and a sprinkle of pecorino romano cheese before serving.
Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated cheese and crispy bacon.
Finish with additional black pepper and grated pecorino or parmesan cheese before serving.
